posts.text: Thermodynamics of reversible batteries Basics of thermodynamics of electrochemistry Faraday's Law During electrolysis, the amount of substance precipitated on the electrode is proportional to the excess charge. Where the faraday constant is The equaiton (2) represent the faraday law applied in a more sepecific condition of electrochemial process. The first term is sum of the excess charge of parallel electrochemical reactions. The second term relate to the charging current. The zeroth law of thermodynamics Several phases/systems in contact with each other are in thermal equilibrium condition: all strength properties (temperature, pressure, chemical potential, electrochemical potential) of each phase/system are equal
